title: Ernie Adams named interim football coach at Phillips Andover
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Ernie Adams appointed interim varsity football coach at Phillips Andover for the 2026 season.
Adams, 72, replaces Trey Brown who led the team to a 2-7 record in 2025.
Adams, a former Patriots research director, played football at Phillips Andover with Bill Belichick.

title: 2 ‘storybook escapes’ for 2026 are in New England, according to HomeToGo
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: HomeToGo ranks Woodstock, Vermont No. 11 and Bar Harbor, Maine No. 14 for 'storybook escapes' in 2026.
Woodstock's median nightly price per person is $153; search trend increased 105% year-over-year.
Bar Harbor's median nightly price per person is $174, with a 39% increase in search trend.

title: Patriots reportedly set to name Zak Kuhr as defensive coordinator
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Zak Kuhr, 37, is set to be officially named the New England Patriots' defensive coordinator for the 2026 season.
Kuhr took on the interim defensive coordinator role in 2025, leading the Patriots' defense to a top-four ranking.
Former defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will take a high-ranking coaching staff role, while Vinny DePalma replaces Kuhr as inside linebackers coach.

title: This music teacher is running the Boston Marathon for Parkinson’s research
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Owen Hughes Jr., 38, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Parkinson's research via the Michael J. Fox Foundation.
Hughes, an elementary music teacher from White Plains, New York, is honoring his father diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.
The Boston Marathon marks Hughes's ninth marathon since he began running in 2022, combining personal goals with charitable causes.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 18)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: In Abington, a Colonial home at 840 Hancock St. sold for $705,000, featuring 4 bedrooms and 3 baths.
A three-family flat at 102 Market St., Amesbury, built in 1870, sold for $965,500 with 5 bedrooms.
A two-bedroom condo on 430 Stuart St., Boston, built in 2023, sold for $1.1 million, encompassing 474 square feet.

title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B suggested a split with Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs during her L.A. concert after unfollowing him on Instagram.
The couple, who went public earlier this year, faced speculation after Patriots loss and Diggs' legal issues.
Diggs is set for a pre-trial hearing in April on battery and strangulation charges from an incident in December.

title: UMass ordered to lift suspension for student who organized pro-Palestinian protest
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: UMass Amherst must lift Junior Kivlighan de Montebello's suspension after a protest organized during a campus career fair.
A court ruled his suspension likely violated First Amendment rights; justice issued a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction.
The protest opposed RTX, a defense contractor recruiting at UMass; Montebello's free speech claim moves forward in court.

title: Hanover police officer charged with motor vehicle homicide in fatal Brockton hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hanover officer Thomas Hayes, 36, charged with motor vehicle homicide in Brockton hit-and-run killing Alfredo Alves, 23.
Hayes drove after drinking at a strip club, allegedly struck Alves, ignored passenger's plea to stop, claimed it was a snowbank.
Hayes arrested with alcohol odor, failed bail conditions; on administrative leave since becoming officer in 2014.

title: Choosing a product that fixes foggy headlights
author: John Paul
bullets: Headlights can fog over time as their protective coating wears away, blocking up to 90% of light.
Turtle Wax cleaning pads may not last, but Meguiarâ€™s Keep Clear Headlight Coating can prevent re-fogging up to a year.
Cleaning foggy headlights is becoming a standard part of car maintenance for better visibility and safety.

title: Man arrested in Fenway on child rape, human trafficking charges
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Talik Rashaun Garcia, 36, was arrested in Fenway for child rape and human trafficking charges after a police investigation.
Garcia pleaded not guilty and was released on $5,000 bail with conditions limiting contact with minors.
The Massachusetts State Police High-Risk Victims Squad assisted in the investigation and arrest, according to Boston police.
